sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A top UK spy agency says demoralized Russian troops in Ukraine are refusing to carry out orders and sabotaging their own equipment, and that Vladimir Putin massively misjudged the invasion. China and Russia's foreign ministers say the world order is shifting after promises of deeper cooperation at the highest-level Beijing-Moscow meeting since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And the UK government in London is poised to take legal steps to force the Northern Ireland executive to provide abortion services to women there.

sentences.sentence: The moment of hope following Tuesday's peace talks in Turkey has all but disappeared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Some 20 percent of troops have been pulled back, but Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky in his nightly address warned Moscow's focus is now the Donbass region in the east.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UK government in Westminster is poised to take legal steps

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: to force the Northern Ireland Executive to provide abortion services to women there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Abortion only became legal in Northern Ireland executive to provide abortion services to women there. Abortion only became legal in Northern Ireland in 2020, but the necessary health services still haven't been put in place. Joining me from London to tell us more is Euronews UK reporter Vincent McAvini.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vincent, thanks very much for being with us. What action is the UK government going to take and why?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Well, just to give a bit of a background on this whereas in Great Britain which is Wales, Scotland and England abortion has been legalized since as far back as the 1960s in Northern Ireland there has been delays on it because of religious and cultural issues. Now as you mentioned there this law was changed in 2020 but during the last couple of years, there's been problems because the devolution settlement in Northern Ireland has collapsed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Assembly, the power sharing between the unionist and Republican parties has not been operating for much of this period. And so that was why in 2020, the change in the law was forced upon the administration there, despite resistance from the DUP, who is the main unionist party who had the first ministership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, once again, in February, ahead of an election which is taking place in May, the parliament there collapsed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That is because the DUP, the unionist party, who are actually completely opposed to abortion services, withdrew their first minister, Paul Gibbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And so what is happening now is Brandon Lewis, the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland in the Westminster government, he has set a deadline for those services to be implemented by yesterday, March 30th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That has now obviously elapsed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And so he says that after the election, which takes place in May, he is going to impose this rule. He's setting up a small team in the department in London, the Northern Ireland department, which has experience with reproductive health services. They will work with the Northern Irish Health Service to make sure that there is proper provisions put in place for this, because he says it is unacceptable that women and girls should be threatened by not having safe and accessible abortions and aftercare services in Northern Ireland. So a very highly complex situation there that you've just done a great job of explaining for us but then can those women and girls be confident that they will be able to access local abortions safely from after the May elections? Well, it is on paper right that the UK should be able to bring this in, that they can from Westminster impose this if devolution is not working properly. But the real question mark here is what happens in those May elections. Will the DUP, the unionist party, stay in power, or will it be a change-up? So, at the moment, Sinn Féin have the deputy first ministership, it's power-sharing. For the first time ever, depending on how this election goes, that could flip, where Sinn Féin gets enough votes and seats to become the party that leads the power-sharing there. But that remains to be seen at the moment there's still weeks to go in this election at the moment the situation is that women in northern ireland can travel south of the border into the republic of ireland and access abortion there they can also travel to great britain to wales england and scotland and access abortion services there but of course not everyone has the means to do that course, not everyone has the means to do that. Germany could be facing a severe shortage in their gas supplies after the G7 rejected

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's demand that payments for Russian gas be made in rubles, citing a unilateral and clear breach of the existing agreements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that should European countries refuse to pay in Russian currency, Moscow would have to take decisions. As it stands, Europe receives 40% of its gas and 25% of its oil from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In light of the war in Ukraine, EU leaders are racing to reduce their dependency on Russian energy imports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As Germany is highly dependent on Russian gas, economics minister Robert Habeck has initiated the early warning stage of their gas emergency plan to prepare for a possible shortage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are at a stage at the moment where we are looking closely at which flows may be at risk or may break off.

sentences.sentence: Security of supply is guaranteed, all contracts are being served at the moment. If they were not being served, it would first be up to the market in the second stage to make the necessary changes or send signals to consumers." It is unclear how long the reserves would last in the event of a Russian supply stop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Habeck says it will depend on the stock remaining in the storage facilities in the coming autumn and winter and urged people to reduce their consumption as every kilowatt hour counts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's why I would like to combine the proclamation of the early warning stage with the appeal to companies as well as private consumers that they help us, that they help Germany, that they help Ukraine if they save gas or energy altogether." The gas emergency plan has three stages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After the early warning stage comes the alert and emergency periods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Only in the third phase does the state intervene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
